column3: It took me a long time to understand the relationship between ideas and between objective facts. But after I clearly understood this relationship, I didn't fool around with other wild ideas. That is one of the main reasons why I just make my scheme as simple as possible.
Anxiety and spiritual searching have been consistent themes with me, and that figures into my worldview. But I tend to make my songs sound like relationship songs.

You tend to meet on a more regular basis with people in your industry, and reality being what it is, you tend to meet with them at the particular level that you occupy; so that develops a fraternity relationship.

Life is relationship, living is relationship. We cannot live if you and I have built a wall around ourselves and just peep over that wall occasionally. Unconsciously, deeply, under the wall, we are related.

Britain is still seen as a beacon for decency, for democracy, for vigorous judges upholding the rule of law and, dare I say it, a free press. I respect the press in theory, but when you see some of the things it writes about you, it's not exactly a happy relationship.
A people's relationship to their heritage is the same as the relationship of a child to its mother.
Love comes when manipulation stops; when you think more about the other person than about his or her reactions to you. When you dare to reveal yourself fully. When you dare to be vulnerable.
Real intimacy is only possible to the degree that we can be honest about what we are doing and feeling.
Sometimes I wonder if men and women really suit each other. Perhaps they should live next door and just visit now and then.
What love we've given, we'll have forever. What love we fail to give, will be lost for all eternity.
Spiritual relationship is far more precious than physical. Physical relationship divorced from spiritual is body without soul.
Once a woman has forgiven her man, she must not reheat his sins for breakfast.
The only time a woman really succeeds in changing a man is when he is a baby.
Caresses, expressions of one sort or another, are necessary to the life of the affections as leaves are to the life of a tree. If they are wholly restrained, love will die at the roots.
A sensible woman should be guided by her head when taking a husband, and by her heart when taking a lover.
I see when men love women. They give them but a little of their lives. But women when they love give everything.
I love you, and because I love you, I would sooner have you hate me for telling you the truth than adore me for telling you lies.
Some people are your relatives but others are your ancestors, and you choose the ones you want to have as ancestors. You create yourself out of those values.
To catch a husband is an art; to hold him is a job.
Almost all of our relationships begin and most of them continue as forms of mutual exploitation, a mental or physical barter, to be terminated when one or both parties run out of goods.
Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
Love sought is good, but given unsought, is better.
We must learn to regard people less in light of what they do or omit to do, and more in the light of what they suffer.
I don't want to be married to someone who feels inferior to my success or because I make more money than he does.
I present myself to you in a form suitable to the relationship I wish to achieve with you.
Love casts out fear, but we have to get over the fear in order to get close enough to love them.
